comments:
I'm trying to run the small RCP tutorial that comes with Eclipse 3.2, I've followed all the steps, but when I click on "Launch the product" I get the following error:

java.lang.ClassNotFoundException:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter
	at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:333)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:280)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:977)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:952)
I ran through the "creating a rich client application" provided in the SDK (linked from the intro page), and I could not get the error you mentionned. Is this what you used?

This is what I used, but now I think I know what went wrong.

In the step "Create the product configuration", if you don't select "Use a launch configuration" but leave the default choice instead ("Create a configuration file with basic settings") then the exception happens.

Since I selected the default choice, I think this exception should not happen.

I'm using Eclipse 3.2 as well.

I'm also getting the same exception, even if I choose a launch configuration.

The tutorial we're referring to is:

http://www.eclipse.org/articles/Article-RCP-1/tutorial1.html

Section "Making it a product"

I got the hint from the section "Troubleshooting" at the bottom of the tutorial. Not only was org.eclipse.osgi missing, but also org.eclipse.core.runtime, and the plugin project itself.

Solution:

1. Select "Configuration" tab.
2. Click on "Add" and choose "org.eclipse.ui.tutorial.rcp.part1"
3. Click on "Add Required Plug-ins" and Ctrl-S for save.
4. Click on "Overview" tab, "Synchronize" and "Launch the product".

Can the tutorial be updated with this information?
